content_type.description: The HTTP Content-Type header value specifying the content type of the body.

data.description: The HTTP request/response body as raw binary.

extensions.description:
Application specific response metadata. Must be set in the first response
for streaming APIs.

console_user.description:
Name of the console user who runs this command

Example: ` "console-user"`
console_user.title: User

username.description:
The user to change password on host

Example: ` "username"`
username.title: Username

collection_start_time.description:
The UTC timestamp when the collection start

Example: ` "2024-06-18T0012"`
collection_start_time.title: Collect Start Time

debug_in_progress.description:
True if debug is in progress

Example: ` "true"`
debug_in_progress.title: Debug In Progress

node_name.description:
Name of the debug bundle

Example: ` "node-name"`
node_name.title: Node Name

validity.description:
The UTC timestamp of the validity of debug bundle 

Example: ` "2024-06-18T2237"`
validity.title: Debug Bundle Validity

status.description:
x-displayName: "Status"
x-example: "map<node-name, OK>"
The map of curl status with key = node name, value = OK / Error
status.title: Status

arp_result.description:
x-displayName: "ARP Result"
x-example: "? (169.254.0.11) at 06:4d:57:fb:c4:07 [ether]..."
Full response of address resolution protocol "arp -an" on host
arp_result.title: ARP Result

dns_connectivity.description:
x-displayName: "DNS Connectivity"
Ping DNS (from /etc/resolv.conf) to check connectivity
dns_connectivity.title: DNS Connectivity

dns_query_result.description:
x-displayName: "DNS Query Result"
x-example: "@192.168.0.2 https://downloads.volterra.io\n; (1 server found)..."
Dig DNS to resolve DNS for domains
dns_query_result.title: DNS Query Result

domain_curl_result.description:
x-displayName: "Domain Curl Result"
x-example: "map<domain-url, curl-status>"
The curl status for all required domains from all nodes
domain_curl_result.title: Domain Curl Result

errors.description:
x-displayName: "Errors"
x-example: "map<command, error-messages>"
The map of errors with key = diagnosis command, value = all error messages for that command
errors.title: Errors

ifconfig_result.description:
x-displayName: "Interface Config"
x-example: "argo-end: flags=4163\u003cUP,BROADCAST,..."
Full response of interface configuration "ifconfig -a" on host
ifconfig_result.title: Interface Config

node_name.description:
x-displayName: "Node Name"
x-example: "master-0"
Name of the node
node_name.title: Node Name

nodes_connectivity.description:
x-displayName: "Nodes Connectivity"
Ping nodes (if multiple) to check connectivity
nodes_connectivity.title: Nodes Connectivity

ntp_sync_status.description:
x-displayName: "NTP Sync Status"
x-example: "System clock synchronized: yes..."
Full response from "timedatectl status" on host
ntp_sync_status.title: NTP Sync Status

registration_status.description:
x-displayName: "Registration Status"
x-example: "OK"
Indicate whether registration is success or failed with some error
registration_status.title: Registration Status

resolv_conf.description:
x-displayName: "Resolv Conf"
x-example: "nameserver 192.168.0.2..."
Full response of /etc/resolv.conf information
resolv_conf.title: Resolv Conf

route_result.description:
x-displayName: "Route Result"
x-example: "Kernel IP routing table..."
Full response from "route -n" on host
route_result.title: Route Result

curl_response.description:
The subset from full diagnosis response of Domain Curl Result for all required domains from all nodes

Example: ` "map<domain-url, curl-status>"`
curl_response.title: Curl Responses

registration_status.description:
The subset from full diagnosis response of Registration Status from all nodes

Example: ` "map<node-name, registration-status>"`
registration_status.title: Registration Status

responses.description:
The full diagnosis response of all nodes

Example: ` "map<node-name, diganosis-response-object>"`
responses.title: Responses

exec_log.description: Exec Log output from specific service
exec_log.title: Exec Log

debugExecRequest.description: Request to execute cli command on a specific node in site
debugExecRequest.title: Exec Request

console_user.description:
Name of the console user who runs this command

Example: ` "console-user"`
console_user.title: User

namespace.description:
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

output.description:
Output of the requested command.

Example: ` "Non-authoritative answer:\nName   google.com\nAddress: 172.217.12.110"`
output.title: Command output

return_code.description:
Return code of requested command

Example: ` "0"`
return_code.title: Reture code

initial_password_changed.description: If the factory password changed on host
initial_password_changed.title: Factory Password Changed

lte_support.description: If the box has LTE support
lte_support.title: LTE Support

public_ip.description: Public IP gives vhost0 or other primary IP
public_ip.title: Public IP

wifi_support.description: If the box has WIFI support
wifi_support.title: WIFI Support

debugHostPingRequest.description: Request to initiate ping from the site
debugHostPingRequest.title: Host Ping Request

dest.description:
Destination to ping can be IP Address or DNS name

Example: ` "google.com"`
dest.title: Destination

interval.description:
Interval is the wait time between each packet send. Default is 1s (1000ms).

Example: ` "1000"`
interval.title: Interval

length.description:
Size of packet being sent

Example: ` "56"`
length.title: Length

namespace.description:
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

debugHostPingResponse.description: Response to initiated ping from the site
debugHostPingResponse.title: Host Ping Response

avg_rtt.description:
AvgRtt is the average round-trip time.

Example: ` "76.599s"`
avg_rtt.title: Average RTT

dest_ip.description:
Destination IP is the address of the host being pinged.

Example: ` "8.8.8.8"`
dest_ip.title: Destination IP

lost.description:
Lost is the percentage of packets lost.

Example: ` "0"`
lost.title: Packets Lost

max_rtt.description:
MaxRtt is the maximum round-trip time.

Example: ` "134.83s"`
max_rtt.title: Max RTT

min_rtt.description:
MinRtt is the minimum round-trip time.

Example: ` "44.686s"`
min_rtt.title: Min RTT

received.description:
Received is the number of packets received.

Example: ` "5"`
received.title: Packets Received

sent.description:
Sent is the number of packets sent.

Example: ` "5"`
sent.title: Packets Sent

std_dev_rtt.description:
StdDevRtt is the standard deviation of the round-trip times.

Example: ` "30.619s"`
std_dev_rtt.title: Standard Deviation RTT

debugRebootRequest.description: Request to reboot specific node in site
debugRebootRequest.title: Reboot Request

namespace.description:
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

debugService.description: Name and formal displayed name of the service
debugService.title: Service

name.description:
Formal displayed name of service

Example: ` "F5XC Platform Manager"`
name.title: Name

debugSoftRestartRequest.description: Request to soft restart reloads VER instance on the node
debugSoftRestartRequest.title: Soft restart Request

namespace.description:
Namespace for which the request is sent (system)

Example: ` "value"`
namespace.title: Namespace

message.description:
Human readable reason of the Status

Example: ` "containers with unready status[wingman opera]"`
message.title: Message

debugVpmState.description:
State of Site defines in which operational state site itself is.

Site is waiting for input configuration.
Site is waiting for approval.
Site is in provisioning state.
Site is in provisioned.
Site is in failed state. It failed during any stage.
Site is in factory resetting mode
debugVpmState.title: VpmState

type_url.description:
A URL/resource name that uniquely identifies the type of the serialized
protocol buffer message. This string must contain at least
one "/" character. The last segment of the URL's path must represent
the fully qualified name of the type (as in
`path/google.protobuf.Duration`). The name should be in a canonical form
(e.g., leading "." is not accepted).

In practice, teams usually precompile into the binary all types that they
expect it to use in the context of Any. However, for URLs which use the
scheme `http`, `https`, or no scheme, one can optionally set up a type
server that maps type URLs to message definitions as follows:

* If no scheme is provided, `https` is assumed.
* An HTTP GET on the URL must yield a [google.protobuf.Type][]
  value in binary format, or produce an error.
* Applications are allowed to cache lookup results based on the
  URL, or have them precompiled into a binary to avoid any
  lookup. Therefore, binary compatibility needs to be preserved
  on changes to types. (Use versioned type names to manage
  breaking changes.)

Note: this functionality is not currently available in the official
protobuf release, and it is not used for type URLs beginning with
type.googleapis.com.

Schemes other than `http`, `https` (or the empty scheme) might be
used with implementation specific semantics.

value.description: Must be a valid serialized protocol buffer of the above specified type.

schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.description: BlindfoldSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by F5XC Secret Management
schemaBlindfoldSecretInfoType.title: BlindfoldSecretInfoType

decryption_provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Secret Management service.

Example: ` "value"`
decryption_provider.title: Decryption Provider

location.description:
Location is the uri_ref. It could be in url format for string:///
 Or it could be a path if the store provider is an http/https location

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
location.title: Location

store_provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "value"`
store_provider.title: Store Provider

schemaClearSecretInfoType.description: ClearSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret that is not encrypted.
schemaClearSecretInfoType.title: ClearSecretInfoType

provider.description:
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the store to get encrypted bytes
 This field needs to be provided only if the url scheme is not string:///

Example: ` "box-provider"`
provider.title: Provider

url.description:
URL of the secret. Currently supported URL schemes is string:///.
 For string:/// scheme, Secret needs to be encoded Base64 format.
 When asked for this secret, caller will get Secret bytes after Base64 decoding.

Example: ` "string:///U2VjcmV0SW5mb3JtYXRpb24="`

Required: YES

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.message.required: true
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.max_bytes: 131072
  ves.io.schema.rules.string.uri_ref: true
url.title: URL

schemaSecretEncodingType.description:
x-displayName: "Secret Encoding"
SecretEncodingType defines the encoding type of the secret before handled by the Secret Management Service.

 - EncodingNone: x-displayName: "None"
No Encoding
 - EncodingBase64: Base64

x-displayName: "Base64"
Base64 encoding
schemaSecretEncodingType.title: SecretEncodingType

schemaSecretType.description: SecretType is used in an object to indicate a sensitive/confidential field
schemaSecretType.title: SecretType

schemaVaultSecretInfoType.description:
x-displayName: "Vault Secret"
VaultSecretInfoType specifies information about the Secret managed by Hashicorp Vault.
schemaVaultSecretInfoType.title: VaultSecretInfoType

key.description:
x-displayName: "Key"
x-example: "key_pem"
Key of the individual secret. Vault Secrets are stored as key-value pair.
If user is only interested in one value from the map, this field should be set to the corresponding key.
If not provided entire secret will be returned.
key.title: Key

location.description:
x-displayName: "Location"
x-required
x-example: "v1/data/vhost_key"
Path to secret in Vault.
location.title: Location

provider.description:
x-displayName: "Provider"
x-required
x-example: "vault-vh-provider"
Name of the Secret Management Access object that contains information about the backend Vault.
provider.title: Provider

version.description:
x-displayName: "Version"
x-example: "1"
Version of the secret to be fetched. As vault secrets are versioned, user can specify this field to fetch specific version.
If not provided latest version will be returned.
version.title: Version

schemaWingmanSecretInfoType.description:
x-displayName: "Wingman Secret"
WingmanSecretInfoType specifies the handle to the wingman secret
schemaWingmanSecretInfoType.title: WingmanSecretInfoType

name.description:
x-displayName: "Name"
x-required
x-example: "ChargeBack-API-Key"
Name of the secret.
name.title: Name

cache.description:
CPU cache size in KB

Example: ` "8192"`
cache.title: cache

cores.description:
number of physical CPU cores

Example: ` "4"`
cores.title: cores

speed.description:
CPU clock rate in MHz

Example: ` "4200"`
speed.title: speed

threads.description:
number of logical (HT) CPU cores

Example: ` "4"`
threads.title: threads

gpu_device.description: List of GPU devices in server
gpu_device.title: GPUDevice

siteLinkQuality.description:
Link quality determined by VER using different probes

Unknown quality
Link quality is good
Link quality is poor
Quality disabled
siteLinkQuality.title: Link quality

siteLinkType.description:
Link type of interface determined operationally

Link type unknown
Link type ethernet
WiFi link of type 802.11ac
WiFi link of type 802.11bgn
Link type 4G
WiFi link
Wan link
siteLinkType.title: Link type

speed.description:
RAM data rate in MT/s

Example: ` "value"`
speed.title: speed

type.description:
type of memory, eg. DDR4

Example: ` "DDR4"`
type.title: type

driver.description:
driver of device, eg. e1000e

Example: ` "e1000e"`
driver.title: driver

name.description:
name of device, eg. eth0

Example: ` "eth0"`
name.title: name

speed.description:
device max supported speed in Mbps

Example: ` "1000"`
speed.title: speed

name.description:
Name of OS

Example: ` "Container Linux by CoreOS 1855.4.0 (Rhyolite)"`
name.title: name

siteOsInfo.description: OsInfo holds information about host OS and HW
siteOsInfo.title: OsInfo

network.description: List of network devices in server
network.title: network

numa_nodes.description:
Non-uniform memory access (NUMA) nodes count

Example: ` "1"`

Validation Rules:
  ves.io.schema.rules.int32.gte: 0
numa_nodes.title: NUMA Nodes Count

storage.description: List of storage devices in server
storage.title: storage

usb.description: List of USB devices in server
usb.title: USBDevice

name.description:
product name, eg. for aws m5a.xlarge. Info taken from /sys/class/dmi/id/product_name

Example: ` "m5a.xlarge"`
name.title: name

serial.description:
serial number, eg. for aws ec254b6d-9676-1a51-8b10-21370dbdc3e5. Info taken from /sys/class/dmi/id/product_serial

Example: ` "ec254b6d-9676-1a51-8b10-21370dbdc3e5"`
serial.title: serial

vendor.description:
vendor name, eg. for aws Amazon EC2. Info taken from /sys/class/dmi/id/product_vendor

Example: ` "value"`
vendor.title: vendor

version.description:
version name. Info taken from /sys/class/dmi/id/product_version

Example: ` "value"`
version.title: version

name.description:
name of device, eg. nvme0n1

Example: ` "nvme0n1"`
name.title: name

address.description:
Address of the device on the bus in decimal

Example: ` "4"`
address.title: address

b_device_class.description:
The class of this device

Example: ` "hub"`
b_device_class.title: b_device_class

b_device_protocol.description:
The protocol (within the sub-class) of this device

Example: ` "0002"`
b_device_protocol.title: b_device_protocol

b_device_sub_class.description:
The sub-class (within the class) of this device

Example: ` "hub"`
b_device_sub_class.title: b_device_sub_class

b_max_packet_size.description:
Maximum size of the control transfer

Example: ` "64"`
b_max_packet_size.title: b_max_packet_size

bus.description:
The bus on which the device was detected in decimal

Example: ` "1"`
bus.title: bus

description.description:
Device description

Example: ` "NetVista Full Width Keyboard (IBM Corp.)"`
description.title: description

i_product.description:
Product name reported by device

Example: ` "xHCI Host Controller"`
i_product.title: i_product

i_serial.description:
Index of Serial Number String Descriptor

Example: ` "0000:00:14.0"`
i_serial.title: i_serial_number

id_product.description:
Product ID (Assigned by Manufacturer) in hex

Example: ` "0x0002"`
id_product.title: id_product

id_vendor.description:
Vendor ID (Assigned by USB Org) in hex

Example: ` "0x1d6b"`
id_vendor.title: id_vendor

port.description:
Port on which the device was detected in decimal

Example: ` "3"`
port.title: port

product_name.description:
Product ID translated to name (if available)

Example: ` "NetVista Full Width Keyboard"`
product_name.title: product_name

speed.description:
The negotiated operating speed for the device

Example: ` "high"`
speed.title: speed

vendor_name.description:
Vendor ID translated to name (if available)

Example: ` "IBM Corp."`
vendor_name.title: vendor_name

siteUsbType.description:
Type of USB device

Unknown USB device type
Internal USB present in Certified HW
USB device present during node registration
USB device that can be matched by USB rules
siteUsbType.title: UsbType
